content:
Here is the cleaned up text:

FlexCards Element Dimensions

Set the height and width, and configure the responsiveness of a FlexCard element within the FlexCard Designer.

Configure the height, minimum height, and maximum height of the element using CSS supported values. See Adjust the Height of an Element on a FlexCard.

Enable responsiveness on one or more elements to set the width to change as the width of the visible area of a page, called the viewport, changes. The responsive sizing of elements is mobile-first. Sizing starts at the smallest visible viewport breakpoint and is continuously applied upwards until the next wider breakpoint overrides it.

FlexCards Element Dimensions Properties
Update the height and width, and configure responsiveness for your element from the Style panel in the FlexCard Designer when an element is selected.

Adjust the Height of an Element on a FlexCard
Enter any CSS supported values or enter a CSS function to update the height of an element on a FlexCard.

Adjust the Width of an Element on a FlexCard
After dragging an element into a state, adjust its width along a 12-column horizontal grid. The width of an element is 1 to 12 parts of a 12 column grid.

FlexCards Element Responsiveness
Enable responsiveness on one or more elements to set the width to change as the visible area of a page changes. By default, the width of an element is the same regardless of the width of the viewport device.

Create Responsive Elements on a FlexCard
Enable an element's width to change when the viewport updates. For example, make the widths of fields take the full width of the page on smaller devices, but shrink to 50% on larger devices such as laptops and desktops.
title: Configuring FlexCard Element Dimensions
